briefdescription.para: The point type.
The type used to represent an index.

description.para: Each range R in this section has a nested type R::iterator, is convertible to std::pair<R::iterator,R::iterator>, so that one can use boost::tie(), and can be used with BOOST_FOREACH(), as well as with the C++11 range based for-loop.

briefdescription.para: returns the iterator range of the vertices of the mesh.
returns the iterator range of the halfedges of the mesh.

description.para: A Properties::Property_map<I,T> allows to associate properties of type T to a vertex, halfdge, edge, or face index type I.
Properties can be added, and looked up with a string, and they can be removed at runtime. The point property of type P is associated to the string "v:point".

briefdescription.para: Model of LvaluePropertyMap with I as key type and T as value type, where I is either a vertex, halfedge, edge, or face index type.

memberdef.definition: std::pair< Property_map< I, T >, bool > CGAL::Surface_mesh< P >::add_property_map
memberdef.name: add_property_map

briefdescription.para: adds a property map named name with value type T and default t for index type I.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the property map together with a Boolean that is true if a new map was created. In case it already exists the existing map together with false is returned.

memberdef.definition: std::optional< Property_map< I, T > > CGAL::Surface_mesh< P >::property_map
memberdef.name: property_map

briefdescription.para: returns an optional property map named name with key type I and value type T.
removes property map p.

detaileddescription.para: The memory allocated for that property map is freed.

briefdescription.para: removes all property maps for index type I added by a call to add_property_map<I>().

detaileddescription.para: The memory allocated for those property maps is freed.

briefdescription.para: removes all property maps for all index types added by a call to add_property_map().

detaileddescription.para: The memory allocated for those property maps is freed.

briefdescription.para: returns a vector with all strings that describe properties with the key type I.

parameterdescription.para: The key type of the properties.

briefdescription.para: returns the property for the string "v:point".
returns the point associated to vertex v.
returns the point associated to vertex v.

description.para: Copy constructors as well as assignment do also copy simplices marked as removed.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Copy constructor: copies rhs to *this. Performs a deep copy of all properties.
Move constructor.
assigns rhs to *this. Performs a deep copy of all properties.
move assignment
assigns rhs to *this. Does not copy custom properties.
adds a new vertex, and resizes vertex properties if necessary.
adds a new vertex, resizes vertex properties if necessary, and sets the point property to p.

simplesect.para: Several vertices may have the same point property.

briefdescription.para: adds a new edge, and resizes edge and halfedge properties if necessary.
adds two opposite halfedges, and resizes edge and halfedge properties if necessary.

detaileddescription.para:
Sets the targets of the halfedge to the given vertices, but does not modify the halfedge associated to the vertices.
The function does not check whether there is already an edge between the vertices.
the halfedge with v1 as target

briefdescription.para: adds a new face, and resizes face properties if necessary.
if possible, adds a new face with vertices from a range with value type Vertex_index.

detaileddescription.para:
The function adds halfedges between successive vertices if they are not yet indicent to halfedges, or updates the connectivity of halfedges already in place. Resizes halfedge, edge, and face properties if necessary.
the face index of the added face, or Surface_mesh::null_face() if the face could not be added.

briefdescription.para: adds a new triangle connecting vertices v0, v1, v2.

simplesect.para: the face index of the added face, or Surface_mesh::null_face() if the face could not be added.

briefdescription.para: adds a new quad connecting vertices v0, v1, v2, v3.

simplesect.para: the face index of the added face, or Surface_mesh::null_face() if the face could not be added.

description.para: Although the elements are only marked as removed their connectivity and properties should not be used.

simplesect.para: Functions in this group do not adjust any of connected elements and usually leave the surface mesh in an invalid state.

briefdescription.para: removes vertex v from the halfedge data structure without adjusting anything.
removes the two halfedges corresponding to e from the halfedge data structure without adjusting anything.
removes face f from the halfedge data structure without adjusting anything.

description.para: Functions to check the number of elements, the amount of space allocated for elements, and to clear the structure.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of vertices in the mesh.
returns the number of halfedges in the mesh.
returns the number of edges in the mesh.
returns the number of faces in the mesh.
returns true iff the mesh is empty, i.e., has no vertices, halfedges and faces.
removes all vertices, halfedge, edges and faces. Collects garbage but keeps all property maps.
removes all vertices, halfedge, edges and faces.

detaileddescription.para: Collects garbage and removes all property maps added by a call to add_property_map() for all simplex types.
After calling this method, the object is the same as a newly constructed object. The additional property maps are also removed and must thus be re-added if needed.

briefdescription.para: reserves space for vertices, halfedges, edges, faces, and their currently associated properties.
copies the simplices from other, and copies values of properties that already exist under the same name in *this.

detaileddescription.para: In case *this has a property that does not exist in other the copied simplices get the default value of the property.

description.para: While removing elements only marks them as removed garbage collection really removes them.

The API in this section allows to check whether an element is removed, to get the number of removed elements, and to collect garbage. The number of elements together with the number of removed elements is an upperbound on the index, and is needed by algorithms that temporarily store a property in a vector of the appropriate size. Note however that by garbage collecting elements get new indices. In case you store indices in an auxiliary data structure or in a property these indices are potentially no longer referring to the right elements. When adding elements, by default elements that are marked as removed are recycled.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of vertices in the mesh which are marked removed.
returns the number of halfedges in the mesh which are marked removed.
returns the number of edges in the mesh which are marked removed.
returns the number offaces in the mesh which are marked removed.
returns whether vertex v is marked removed.
returns whether halfedge h is marked removed.
returns whether edge e is marked removed.
returns whether face f is marked removed.
checks if any vertices, halfedges, edges, or faces are marked as removed.
really removes vertices, halfedges, edges, and faces which are marked removed.

simplesect.para: By garbage collecting elements get new indices. In case you store indices in an auxiliary data structure or in a property these indices are potentially no longer referring to the right elements.

briefdescription.para: controls the recycling or not of simplices previously marked as removed upon addition of new elements.

detaileddescription.para: When set to true (default value), new elements are first picked in the garbage (if any) while if set to false only new elements are created.

briefdescription.para: Getter.

description.para: Functions in this group perform checks for structural consistency of a complete surface mesh, or an individual element.
They are expensive and should only be used in debug configurations.

briefdescription.para: perform an expensive validity check on the data structure and print found errors to std::cerr when verbose == true.
performs a validity check on a single vertex.
performs a validity check on a single halfedge.
performs a validity check on a single edge.
performs a validity check on a single face.
returns the vertex the halfedge h points to.
sets the vertex the halfedge h points to to v.
returns the face incident to halfedge h.
sets the incident face to halfedge h to f.
returns the next halfedge within the incident face.
returns the previous halfedge within the incident face.
sets the next halfedge of h within the face to nh and the previous halfedge of nh to h.
returns an incoming halfedge of vertex v.

detaileddescription.para:
If v is a border vertex this will be a border halfedge.
target(halfedge(v)) == v

briefdescription.para: sets the incoming halfedge of vertex v to h.
returns a halfedge of face f.
sets the halfedge of face f to h.
returns the opposite halfedge of h. Note that there is no function set_opposite().
returns the vertex the halfedge h emanates from.
returns opposite(next(h)), that is the next halfedge clockwise around the target vertex of h.
returns prev(opposite(h)), that is the previous halfedge clockwise around the target vertex of h.
returns next(opposite(h)), that is the next halfedge clockwise around the source vertex of h.
returns opposite(prev(h)), that is the previous halfedge clockwise around the source vertex of h.
returns the i'th vertex of edge e, for i=0 or 1.
finds a halfedge between two vertices.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a default constructed Halfedge_index, if source and target are not connected.

briefdescription.para: returns the edge that contains halfedge h as one of its two halfedges.
returns the halfedge corresponding to the edge e.
returns the i'th halfedge of edge e, for i=0 or 1.
returns the number of incident halfedges of vertex v.
returns the number of incident halfedges of face f.

description.para: A halfedge, or edge is on the border of a surface mesh if it is incident to a null_face().

A vertex is on a border if it is isolated or incident to a border halfedge. While for a halfedge and edge this is a constant time operation, for a vertex it means to look at all incident halfedges. If algorithms operating on a surface mesh maintain that the halfedge associated to a border vertex is a border halfedge, this is a constant time operation too. This section provides functions to check if an element is on a border and to change the halfedge associated to a border vertex.

briefdescription.para: returns whether v is a border vertex.

detaileddescription.para: With the default value for check_all_incident_halfedges the function iteratates over the incident halfedges. With check_all_incident_halfedges == false the function returns true, if the incident halfedge associated to vertex v is a border halfedge, or if the vertex is isolated. If the data contained in the Surface_mesh is not a 2-manifold, then this operation is not guaranteed to return the right result.

briefdescription.para: returns whether h is a border halfege, that is if its incident face is sm.null_face().
returns whether e is a border edge, i.e., if any of its two halfedges is a border halfedge.
iterates over the incident halfedges and sets the incident halfedge associated to vertex v to a border halfedge and returns true if it exists.
applies set_vertex_halfedge_to_border_halfedge(Vertex_index) on all vertices around the face associated to h.
applies set_vertex_halfedge_to_border_halfedge(Vertex_index) on all vertices of the surface mesh.
returns whether v is isolated, i.e., incident to Surface_mesh::null_halfedge().
returns Vertex_index(std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max()).
returns Edge_index(std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max()).
returns Halfedge_index(std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max()).
returns Face_index(std::numeric_limits<size_type>::max()).
make sure that the incoming halfedge of vertex v is a border halfedge if v is a border vertex.
Inserts other into sm.

detaileddescription.para: Shifts the indices of vertices of other by sm.number_of_vertices() + sm.number_of_removed_vertices() and analogously for halfedges, edges, and faces. Copies entries of all property maps which have the same name in sm and other. that is, property maps which are only in other are ignored. Also copies elements which are marked as removed, and concatenates the freelists of sm and other.

briefdescription.para: This operator calls write_OFF(std::ostream& os, const CGAL::Surface_mesh& sm).
Extracts the surface mesh from an input stream in OFF and appends it to the surface mesh sm.

detaileddescription.para: This operator calls read_OFF(std::istream& is, CGAL::Surface_mesh& sm).

briefdescription.para: This class is a data structure that can be used as halfedge data structure or polyhedral surface.

detaileddescription.para:
It is an alternative to the classes HalfedgeDS and Polyhedron_3 defined in the packages Halfedge Data Structures and 3D Polyhedral Surface. The main difference is that it is indexed based and not pointer based, and that the mechanism for adding information to vertices, halfedges, edges, and faces is much simpler and done at runtime and not at compile time. When elements are removed, they are only marked as removed, and a garbage collection function must be called to really remove them.
P
The type of the point property of a vertex. There is no requirement on P, besides being default constructible and assignable. In typical use cases it will be a 2D or 3D point type. Is model of
MutableFaceGraph
FaceListGraph
Graph Concepts
